definition: lit. cries of complaint fill the roads (idiom); complaints rise all around/discontent is openly voiced

sentences.chinese: 漁民因此頭昏目眩而怨聲載道。

sentences.english: Internet chat rooms are packed with frustrated CFA candidates.
sentences.chinese: CFA考生在互聯網聊天室裏怨聲載道。

sentences.english: The grumbles died down. Then the stories began.
sentences.chinese: 抱怨聲漸漸消失了，然後大家開始講故事。

sentences.english: Every other country complains about your bank-secrecy laws.
sentences.chinese: 《銀行保密法》是衆矢之的，其他國家全都怨聲載道。

sentences.english: When such complaints arise in France's most sensitive industry -- nuclear power -- alarm bells start ringing.
sentences.chinese: 當法國最敏感的核能產業怨聲四起時，警鐘已經敲響。

sentences.english: Complaints of abuses by troops are mounting.
sentences.chinese: 指責他濫用軍隊的抱怨聲越來越高。

sentences.english: Granted, this complaint often comes from sour-grapes rivals.
sentences.chinese: 誠然，抱怨聲往往來自四家“說葡萄酸”的對手那。

sentences.english: You can hear the hollering on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 你可以聽到交易廳中怨聲載道。

sentences.english: The citizens complained to heaven about the tax burden.
sentences.chinese: 公民對苛捐雜稅怨聲載道。

sentences.english: Although an agreement has been reached, rumbles of resentment can still be heard.
sentences.chinese: 儘管已經達成了協議，但不滿的抱怨聲仍時有所聞。
許多抱怨聲將接踵而至。

sentences.english: Local residents often complain about noise and crime associated with the bases.
sentences.chinese: 駐軍噪音擾民甚至從事犯罪活動，當地居民怨聲載道。
